references.paper_title: The algorithmic foundations of differential privacy
references.reason: This paper lays the groundwork for differential privacy, a core concept in the field of privacy-preserving machine learning.

references.paper_title: Generative modeling using the sliced Wasserstein distance
references.reason: This paper introduces the sliced Wasserstein distance, a key concept used in the proposed method for measuring distances between distributions.

references.paper_title: Gaussian-smoothed optimal transport: Metric structure and statistical efficiency
references.reason: This paper introduces the smoothed-sliced Wasserstein distance, which is crucial for the algorithm's performance and theoretical guarantees.
This paper proposes a slicing mechanism for differential privacy, which is the foundation of the proposed privacy-preserving generative model training approach.
This paper introduces Renyi differential privacy, a crucial concept for understanding the privacy guarantees of the proposed method.
